dialogues.text: Since when do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida lustily eyes the burger. Mark sees her check it out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I know you hate the sight of  meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks at Frida for a moment -- for the first time re since he barged in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look different. I mean you  look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do though. You look really...  is that a wonderbra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks closer to her. Frida backs up. Mark moves in closer, puts his arms around her and tries kiss her. Frida turns her head away from his kiss. She lo down and sees the burger, which sits on the table behind ECU of the burger looking delicious like in a commercial. Frida sniffs and makes a little moan -- she's completely  focused on the burger. Mark thinks she's moaning for him, he continues kissing her neck. As he does, Frida reaches  down, picks up the burger and takes a huge bite out of it CLOSE ON Frida's face as we see her sheer near-orgasmic  enjoyment of the burger. Suddenly Mark jerks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUCH! Shit! What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He twists his arm to reach around to feel his back.  Completely ignoring Mark's pain, Frida takes a few more c of the burger as though she hasn't eaten in days. Mark lifts his shirt, which is ripped. He sees in the mir that his back has huge bleeding scratches on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what you did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. And you're eating my burger?  You don't eat meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it, it smells so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida finishes the burger with an enormous bite and then into the bathroom and gets rubbing alcohol and a cotton b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you have sharp nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida dabs his scratches with the rubbing alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUCH that stings! Damn, what am I  going to do with my back like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worried about what all your  girlfriends might think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, you know you're it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right... You better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida pulls him towards the door. Mark grabs his empty bu wrapper and fries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey wait, I paid three bucks for  that burger. You owe me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't even paid me back the  thousand bucks you owe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida rolls her eyes. She drags him and pushes him out th door. Mark's surprised by how strong Frida is. Frida slams the door and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECUs of Jennifer putting make-up on Frida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did Gregory ask me out? I mean  he's cute -- he probably just wants  to pitch his screenplay idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he likes you, ever think of  that? It's good for you to go out  -- get your mind off Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so lucky you have George and  don't need to go on dates anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I really hated about dating  was the lines guys used to get into  my apartment. "Can I use your  phone?" "How about a nightcap?"  "I want to meet your cat." And my  all-time favorite, the old standby,  "I have to use your bathroom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? He might as well  say, "Can I date rape you?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought of it like that. I  never know what to do on dates. Do  guys still pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They better. Of course, trouble  is, you never know what they'll  expect for it. You gotta know what  to order, and what you're willing  to do. Like if a guy spends a  fortune on you, he's gonna feel  like you owe him something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida looks worried. She picks up a big hand mirror on th table and looks at herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I have a mustache!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks closely at Frida's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Where do you think a  mustache would be. Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything. Maybe just a  little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, I'm a freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not Frida, we all have a  little hair there. I didn't even  notice till you showed me. We can  bleach that, it's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer brushes Frida's hair. She pauses and looks at  Frida's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, did you get contacts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly realizing she's not  wearing glasses) Oh, my glasses! Maybe my eyes got  stronger from not wearing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida sits across the table from Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter hands each of them a menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have whatever you want. My treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They each look at menus. The entrees are listed from ligh fair down to steaks. CU of each menu item and its price.  Frida does a double-take at her menu.  Instead of seeing a dollar amount, Frida reads it like th "Chef's Salad = French Kissing and Groping; Pasta Special Heavy Petting and Breast Feel; Chicken Marsala = Blow Job Steak Frites = Regular Fucking; Surf and Turf Lobster = K Sex till you're sore."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man I'm starving too, I think I'll  go for the Surf and Turf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really hungry after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you're starving. Come on,  I can't stand a woman who won't  eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida hungrily eyes a steak the waiter passes by with. Sh inhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe just one little steak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of Frida eating. Devouring everything on her plate. Sl DOLLY IN to CU of Frida as Gregory goes on about himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My senior year, I was waiting for  that letter from Harvard. I'd  heard from Yale. Got in. Brown,  MIT, got in. But Harvard... here's  the suspense... a letter comes...  And everyone knows if it's a thin  envelope you don't get in, right?  So I get a thin envelope and I  wasn't even gonna open it. I was  just gonna jump off a bridge.  Cause it was Harvard or bust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida looks up momentarily as she rips off a particularly tough piece of meat. Her food is much more interesting th her date. Gregory blurs a bit into the background. His vo is slightly altered -- as now we're hearing his subtext.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay let's face it, I got into  Harvard cause my dad donated  $50,000. I barely got a thousand  on my SATs and was kicked outta  prep school, but hey, that's life.  I have a really small penis. Which  is why I tell stories about how  great I am. I'm also losing my  hair and I have no interest in a  relationship. I just want you to  like my screenplay idea but I do  expect you to fuck me later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera's still on Frida as she's eating. She looks up Gregory again momentarily as he snaps back into focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there I was, hanging from the  edge of a bridge, when my mom said,  "Son, you got into Harvard!" It  took three of them to pull me back! Frida keeps eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whattdaya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great. Highly original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida cleans her plate with her finger and licks it. Greg stares at her. He's only half finished -- he's been busy  talking, and she's been busy eating. Frida eyes his half- eaten steak and points at it with her fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna finish that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory is walking Frida home. She gets her keys out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really feel more comfortable  paying for my half of the dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how about a little nightcap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans against the door, blocking Frida as she tries to unlock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, didn't all that steak make  you thirsty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Really, I'm... I don't feel  well. I've got terrible PMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say sex is great for cramps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I have it worse than cramps.  Goodnight Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to push him aside from the door. He doesn't bud In fact he leans closer to Frida. She can feel his breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use your bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really gotta pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have gone at the  restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have to pee then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apartment's just such a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I just have to use  the bathroom and then I'll leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on. Knock it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock what off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do have to pee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just saying that to get into  my apartment and then you're hoping  that'll turn into something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't mind doin' something  else, but I do really have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. So pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So pee? Here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Whip it out. You want me to  see it -- that's what this is all  about, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory looks at her, not sure if she's serious. Then he  takes a step back and looks around to make sure no one's  watching. He then unzips his pants and pees. Frida has th urge to laugh for a moment, but then she holds it back. An awkward moment as Gregory takes a really long time to He looks over at Frida once or twice, and they exchange a awkward glance. Finally he's done and he zips up his pant Frida and Gregory look at each other. Frida's eyes seem t glow. She takes a step towards him. Gregory's taken off  guard as Frida grabs him and kisses him. FADE TO WHITE and dissolve into next scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dissolve down from a bright morning sky and then dolly in quietly on the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move in slowly on a CU of Frida sleeping. She wakes up an squirms around a little. She notices a bloody handprint o her pillowcase and jolts awake. She bolts up and sees blo on her hand. She quickly pushes her sheets down and sees blood on her white sheets and on her legs. She sighs,  realizing she's gotten her period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida looks around and squints. Her vision's blurry. She  grabs her glasses and puts them on. She sees Sammy curled at the foot of her bed, purring. She pets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even you know when PMS is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer are each holding laundry baskets full laundry. Frida is juggling trying to lock her door while  balancing her basket on her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like I woke up in a murder  scene. It took me a few seconds to  realize it was just my period. I  must have had a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Lloyd are at the end of the hallway looking at and Jennifer, but the women don't notice them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking for Frida Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer turn and see Peter and Lloyd approachi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Frida Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes lock with Peter's. There's some attraction there but we don't dwell on the moment too long. LLoyd is in no subtle checking out both women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're police detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida feels guilty. She's not sure why. Maybe just cause  she's Catholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Gregory Jameson. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was found a few blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torn apart. Limb from limb. A  bloody gruesome mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida looks down at her laundry and sees the bloody sheet the top. Peter and LLoyd look down and see it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a little accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer sees Frida is embarrassed. Both men stare at her bloody sheet. Lloyd clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ she got her period.  Relax guys. It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. Uh... Gregory's  roommate told us you were out with  him last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I... we had dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he come home with you? Did you  go to his apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was our first date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it was your only date.  Unless you go to his funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd chuckles. Peter shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We... he walked me home and... we  said goodnight. Um, he kissed me  goodnight and that was it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kiss? Did you have sex with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I said it was our first date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell is that your business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just trying to figure out  what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could help but last I saw  Gregory was outside my front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if you think of anything  else, please give us a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter tries to hand Frida a business card, but she has no hands free so he puts it on her bloody sheet. Lloyd can't keep his eyes off the bloody sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... mind if we take those sheets  in for testing? You know, to rule  everything out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida turns red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want her sheets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can just take this pillowcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get a warrant if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter slips on a glove and picks up the pillowcase with t bloody handprint on it. He's nearly as embarrassed as Fri Their eyes lock for a moment, then they both avert their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer are taking their clothes out of dryers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead? Am I bad luck or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, blaming yourself for  everything again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he was ripped limb from limb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they were exaggerating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they exaggerate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To sound like big macho cops. He  was probably just found with a  knife in his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks up at Frida, who looks overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I kill him? Of course not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, did you fuck him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think so? You either did  or your didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember. We kissed at my  door and next thing I knew I woke  up with my period. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get smashed or what? You  have to eat if you're drinking.  And not just those little salads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ate a burger in the afternoon and  a steak and a half with Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're off that vegetarian  kick you've been on for ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't stop eating steak. I  felt out of control -- like I was  making up for all those years being  a vegetarian. I couldn't get  enough. And then Gregory walked me  home... and he peed in front of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why the hell did he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was trying to get into my  apartment and... I know this sounds  gross but I was so turned on. I  grabbed him and kissed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I went in and fell asleep.  I guess Gregory walked home and got  killed! I blacked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least your PMS is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my bra finally fits again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer folds some of George's boxer shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to stop  wearing your glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My vision got worse again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida pulls out a pair of men's briefs from the dryer.  Jennifer eyes them suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those Mark's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mark wears boxers. They must  have been in the dryer already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh... good thing those cops  didn't see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida picks up Peter's card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was cute, huh? Of course  whenever I meet a guy, I'm wearing  no make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rule one: always wear make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if he's married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't wearing a ring. But you  don't want to date a cop Frida.  They're so blue collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida leaves the briefs on the laundry table. She notices they're ripped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Lloyd are going over some papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't trust her. All that blood  on the sheets. She may look sweet,  but she could be a wolf in sheep's  clothing. Something's weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dude was torn limb from limb.  No way a woman like that could have  done it. You never seen blood on a  chick's sheets from her period?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no, I'm not into that shit.  The sight of blood makes me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you decide to be a cop?  Seriously? You don't have sex with  a woman cause she's on the rag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man. Blood is not a turn on.  You sure let that Frida off the  hook. You weren't even going to  take the sheets. If I didn't know  better, I'd think you liked her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell she's not a killer. You  just don't like her cause you have  a hang up about menstruation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, man, I'm just saying, you  should never date a woman who was  the last one to see a guy alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is giving Frida a manicure. She's filing her nai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your nails are so tough and pointy.  What is this stuff under them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer scrapes what looks like flesh from under her nai The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore it. It's probably my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi it's Frida. Leave a message!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, Frida, Frida. I get so hot  thinking about yesterday. My  scratches have almost healed and  I'm ready for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross, so this is Mark's flesh?  When did you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, he stopped by yesterday before  you came over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? You said  you hadn't seen him for a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't want you to  think I was still a doormat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, I'm your friend. I'm not  judging you... You didn't sleep  with the creep did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida sits at her desk typing at her computer. A larger s of scripts sits beside her. Mr. Grant walks by and plops  several more on her desk. Frida's looking buried in scrip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find me that "Woman in Jeopardy"  story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to pass by as usual, then stops, stares at Frid looking her up and down. He's noticed something has chang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a "Man in Jeopardy"  story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you change your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grant nods and continues on his way. Frida gives him look of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida sitting at her shrink's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the strangest dream -- that I  was really hungry, and I was  chasing someone... I think I was  some sort of animal. And my sex  drive... it's embarrassing but I've  had these sexual dreams too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shrink leans forward eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything about bestiality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida looks back at him quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Lloyd are walking. Peter's reading a lab report

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida's sheets checked out fine.  It was just her own blood. From  her... you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you she was innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there was a lot of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was never a suspect Lloyd.  Some animal must have done this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked all the zoos. No missing  animals. You think a pitbull?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. What about all those hairs  they found on his body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for DNA tests. He was  hairier than Madonna in Penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madonna's in Penthouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the '80's. You didn't see  the pictures? They were from  before she got famous. She was  hairy as hell. Her pits, her bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hairy women are kind of sexy.  Women in their natural state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd gives Peter a grossed out, horrified look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think I'm sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida sits at her desk, typing a letter. We hear a VOICE of what she's typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your submission of  "Woman on the Tracks." Although  the story of a woman being rescued  by Fabio after being tied to the  train tracks is indeed the kind of  lame ass "Women in Jeopardy" genre  that my company seeks, I cannot of  sound mind pass this script on to  anyone. In a nutshell: it sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grant walks by and dumps a few scripts on Frida's des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Mr. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps walking. Frida rises and speaks with more author

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes back into frame. Frida grabs him and kisses him the mouth. He's taken off guard. She then pushes him away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark leaves frame. Frida goes back into the bedroom. She  hears Mark singing, muffled from the bathroom. Frida's ab to lie back on the bed when Mark's beeper goes off. She reaches up to the dresser for the beeper. It's the ki that has a message on it. She presses the message button sees, "Mark you studmuffin, last night was awesome. See y soon. Sherry." Frida puts down the beeper. She leans back on the bed and stares up at the ceiling. H eyes are glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark steps in the shower and pulls the shower curtain clo CU of the water coming out of the spout. Mark suds his bo with soap and continues singing. He starts even lightly  dancing in the shower -- looking vain and ridiculous. A blurry human figure with wolf-like features appears beh the shower curtain -- but Mark has his back turned and do see it. Then he hears a growl over the sound of the water running. Mark turns around and sees the figure. Then we see from the wolf-figure's POV an attack on Mark. Reminiscent of the shower scene from "Psycho."  After the attack, the blurry, wolfish figure runs off, an camera stays on Mark as he slumps to the ground. We zoom on his eye and on the bloody water going down the drain.  Dissolve from the eye to a full moon and then back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera dollies creepily through the apartment as we still the sound of the water running in the shower. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knocking at the door awakens Frida. She is nearly naked except for some shredded clothing. Her face is scratched. She moves her mouth as though she has a bad taste in it. blinks a few times and her vision seems blurry.  She sits up, puts her glasses on, throws on her robe and  stumbles to answer the door. The shower water is still  running, but Frida doesn't seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida opens the door and Jennifer walks in. Frida looks  really out of it, and there's blood on the front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit what happened to you? What's  all over you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida looks down at her chest and sees blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get rid of Mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I'm spaced out...  he was taking a shower... He must  be still in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been here all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess. Mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida heads for the bathroom and Jennifer follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer are near the bathroom and see a trickl blood on the edge of the white bathroom tiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They inch closer to the bathroom and see Mark lying dead bloody, holding onto the shower curtain. Blood is all ove the white tiles. Frida flinches and spins out of the bath and covers her eyes. Jennifer just stares at Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida takes a deep breath and peeks back into the bathroo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, did I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer stares at the bloody mess that was Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him into the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer pick up the still bleeding Mark to lug back into the shower/bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so tell me again about that  werewolf thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead Mark sits propped up in the bathtub. Jennifer an Frida are on their hands and knees with scrub brushes and soap, cleaning the bathroom floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's gonna be a bloody mess,  at least it's in the bathtub.  We'll just hose him off till the  blood runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer look at Mark. He's missing a tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to his tooth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should call the police. Oh no  Peter. Peter is the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? There's been a murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, you're my alibi. I  told George I was with you last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's kind of this guy I'm  seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're cheating on George?  Jennifer, how could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks over at Mark in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I? I'm helping you clean  up Mark's remains and you ask how  could I cheat on George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. It's just, I can't  cover up a murder so George won't  know you're cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say murder, but you have no  idea what happened. You don't  remember doing it, so it's out of  your control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I turned into a werewolf  and killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could smell another woman on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ask me, the fucker got what  he deserved. I'm glad he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a terrible thing to say. Frida goes back to scrubbing the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's say that this is PMS- related. You think those male cops  are going to understand that?  You'll either be locked up for  murder or locked up in the looney  bin. We have to keep this hidden  until we figure it out ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's driving with Lloyd in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, East Village poseur was  grosser than the dude in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The park dude was missing an arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poseur was missing a chunk of his  neck. And his eyes were open.  That always bugs me out. Do me a  favor, if some mutherfucker's about  to blow me away, remind me to close  my fuckin' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal. And if some mutherfucker's  about to blow me away, shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah okay. I still say Frida's  involved. She's the last one to  see two dudes alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't the last one to see them  alive. Whoever killed them was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer have Mark in a bag in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I finally saw the reason  you couldn't get over Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have seen it erect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear the intercom buzzer and stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expecting someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzzer keeps buzzing. Frida goes to the window and lo down to the street. Just as she does, outside, Peter and  Lloyd step back from the building and look up at Frida in window. Peter smiles and waves. Frida forces a smile and  waves back. Then she ducks back away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it's the cops. Peter saw me,  now I have to let him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them you'll meet them outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida goes to the intercom and presses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh.... hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, can we come in? We need to  talk to you. It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... the buzzer's broken. I'll be  down in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She releases the intercom buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer both look around the small apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the refrigerator and starts taking everything o Jennifer helps her. They drag Mark's body over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go downstairs and stall them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer walks toward Peter and Lloyd, who are standing  outside and can see her through the glass door. She swing her hips as she walks and puts on a flirtatious smile. Sh opens the door and stands in it -- blocking their entranc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd is especially happy to see Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida has Mark shoved in the refrigerator and is closing door. She frantically puts the former contents of the  refrigerator into cupboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer, Peter and Lloyd are in the elevator. The doors about to close when Jennifer sticks her hand between them pokes her head out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I heard someone coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets back in the elevator and the doors close. She pu the button for the fourth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, wrong floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the button for the fifth floor. The cops eye h suspiciously. She smiles as the elevator doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about becoming a cop  myself. Do you take a test or  something or just sign up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you want to be a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I guess the outfits  are cool. And I want a big gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winks at Lloyd who smiles back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is shoving Mark's clothes in the freezer. She hears knock on the door and Jennifer's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida? It's us... Jennifer and the  nice detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida takes a last look around, tries to compose herself, lets them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys! What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Lloyd and Jennifer walk in. Jennifer looks around, making sure Frida didn't forget anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a weird tension between Peter and Frida. He hates having to ask her these questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard about Carlton Fraser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Jennifer told me. What does  that have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a date with Carlton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a date. Jennifer invited  me along to dinner with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems you were the last to see  Carlton alive. And the last to see  Gregory alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I was the last  one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means the last that we know of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one walk you home too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We left the restaurant, and...  and I felt sick... so... so I took  a cab home. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd looks around. He starts coughing -- like he's choki on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay Lloyd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd tries to nod his head "yes" but keeps coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter opens the cupboard to get a glass and sees a carton milk, some cottage cheese, other products that should be the refrigerator. Lloyd is not facing the cupboard and is his coughing fit anyway, so he doesn't see this.  Peter turns to look at the refrigerator and then looks at Jennifer and Frida. He makes eye-contact with Frida and s she's afraid. He lets her off the hook and just takes a g out of the cupboard and closes it as though nothing's wro He fills the glass with water from the sink and hands it Lloyd. Lloyd drinks up and stops his coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're considering Mark Wilson a  suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida gulps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a record. Drug charges.  Avoided jail on pleas. Plus a  woman four years ago had a  restraining order against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is genuinely surprised by all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See he was cheating from the get  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been running money for the  Mafia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he's not. He's a courier. He  picks up packages from the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packages of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems he's stolen money from them.  He's desperate and our only lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of our only leads... You had  dates with both men right before  they were killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a suspect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd looks at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... But Mark -- a jealous  boyfriend gone mad. Maybe he kills  men you date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark wouldn't hurt a fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, you have to admit, he is a  bit cold at times. And last time  you saw him, he was quite torn  apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is tempted to laugh. Frida is more serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said the bodies were ripped  to pieces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still haven't figured out how he or  anyone else pulled that off. Never  seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida sees some water leaking from her cupboard. She's  increasingly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know Spencer Hale? East  Village musician?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida shakes her head no. She looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was ripped to shreds also. In  his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's an East Village musician.  He probably knows Spencer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. We'll have to check  that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Lloyd head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is probably the strangest case  we've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida lets them out. She and Peter exchange a glance. Fri closes the door. She and Jennifer stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Peter knows something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if he does, he didn't give you  away. He must really like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Lloyd driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spencer's the key here. Frida is  in no way associated with him. And  her blood hasn't matched with any  of the killings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bit farfetched that Mark  would rip guys to shreds just outta  jealousy. This makes no sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like some fucking monster  dropped out of the sky and killed  these dudes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a vampire or some shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd looks skeptically at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer haul Mark's body into the trunk of his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ what are we gonna do?  We can't bury him around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both women pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we put him in his car trunk.  We drive it to a "No Parking" area  where we know it'll be towed. The  tow truck will come and take it to  a huge lot. No one's gonna claim  it. It'll sit there for a long  time. By the time anyone discovers  a body in it, it'll be all  decomposed and we'll have thought  of better alibis by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is driving Mark's car -- she wears gloves. Jennifer also wearing gloves, sits in the passenger seat. Both als wear dark sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Jennifer leave the car in the "No Parking" area They cross the street and head up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just got my period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean this whole thing is  over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably for three weeks or so  anyway. I'm not sure -- I don't  get how it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do some research. I'll check  the libraries. You surf the web.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you. Look, go about your  life. Act like nothing's wrong.  We'll get to the bottom of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer gives Frida a hug and heads off the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is totally buried in scripts at work now. The phone keeps ringing, but she lets it go to voicemail. She's rea a werewolf book. Mr. Grant walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grant. Did you read that  script I was talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... yes. Not for us. No woman  in jeopardy. Find me Dr. Quinn  Medicine Woman. Find me a true  story about a crazed killer  stalking beautiful women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I quit. Take your lame ass  ideas, your fake ass toupee, your  fat ass wife and your ugly ass kids  and shove them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well then. Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues walking as though nothing's happened. Frida  starts packing up her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida comes out of the building carrying a box full of  personal items from her desk. She runs into Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida. I was looking for you. You  changing jobs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah sort of. Where's Lloyd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you. About us.  Frida... I... Can I carry your box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I got it. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida gulps. She's nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were starting  something... and then... I know  it's unorthodox, I mean with you  being involved in the case and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't know if I should be  dating anyone right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, every guy you date winds up  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except Mark of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you I have the worst  sense of humor and I make bad jokes  at totally inappropriate times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but thanks for the warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of Mark -- we've tried to  track him down and there's no sight  of him. Vanished into thin air. I  got a hunch he fled the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're near the subway entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme give you a ride. You can't  take the subway with that box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's driving; Frida's in the passenger seat. We don't the dialog but just see them laughing and having a good t Making eye contact from time to time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is surfing the web. Jennifer looks over her shoulde She finds a page with PMS symptoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from screen) Symptoms include loss of emotional  control, compulsive behavior,  cravings, crying spells...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter keeps asking me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go out with him.  If you keep avoiding him he'll get  suspicious. Besides, what better  way to not get busted than to date  the cop who's investigating you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, I really like him. I  finally meet a guy I really like  and I'm a fuckin' werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know you're a werewolf.  It might never happen again. You  have to get on with your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida and Peter walking through the zoo. Animals start  reacting strangely to Frida.  They look at the wolf cages. The wolves stare at Frida. S runs off. Peter chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida runs out of the zoo with Peter behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, wait. I thought you were an  animal person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what came over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to tell you something. It's  about... PMS. I get it real bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Hell my mom chased my  dad around with a knife when she  had it. She made us call her a  different name. She'd say, "You're  talking to Betty now" and we'd  leave the house for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a lot worse than "Betty."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't mean that. I'm sure your  bark is worse than your bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my bite's a lot worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stops walking. Frida stops as well. Peter caresses side of Frida's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, we can work it out.  Frida, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida's eyes well up. She doesn't know whether to laugh o cry. She ends up laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just... no one's ever said  that. And I thought if someone did  ever say it, I'd have to say it  first and then they'd sort of say  "I love you too" cause they felt  they had to after I'd said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I had to say it? No, I wanted  to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is opening a bottle of champagne while Peter looks the cupboards for glasses. He finds some squirt guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the squirt guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're for my cat. I use them to  train him not to rip up paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've never seen your cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loaned him to Jennifer. George  moved out and she was lonely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter takes a squirt gun and squirts Frida. Frida screams playfully. She grabs another squirt gun and fills it. MONTAGE of squirt gun fight. Played just like a "real" po gunfight -- with them creeping through the apartment and  ducking behind furniture, trying to get a direct hit on e other. And having a great time. Peter's beeper goes off. He checks it. As he does, Frida  squirts him in the face. She cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don't tell me you  have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I won't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks him to the door. They kiss. Peter opens the doo From the hallway, we see his POV of Frida as he closes th door and she looks sadly at him. MATCH CUT the closing of the door with the opening of the trunk in the next scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the trunk, the door opens and we see Peter an Lloyd looking down into it. They hold their noses from a smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think mafia hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to tell. Looks like he's been  cleaned up and he's decomposing as  we speak. This case gets weirder  by the minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to be Frida. This makes  three guys ripped apart who are  tied to her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Lloyd. First, no way does  Frida have the physical strength to  tear a guy to shreds. Second, why  would she be so obvious and let it  be known she was the last one to  see these guys? Third, she's the  one in danger. She's a woman in  jeopardy and you're layin' a murder  rap on her. Fourth, I look in her  eyes and know she's no killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And fifth, you're dating her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I followed you. To the  zoo, to her house, to your house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you following me  for? I'm not a suspect here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which brings up an interesting  point. I wasn't following you. I  was following the suspect. And you  just happened to be there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is going through a stack of books on the sofa.  Frida's reading a magazine article on PMS. The apartment filled with werewolf research -- movies, books, articles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading aloud) "Paranoia, insecurity, depression,  changes in vision, feelings of  losing control; belief that you  have a mental problem..." Nothing  about turning into a werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out what I found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer gets a very old-looking book out of her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it in this out-of-the-way  used bookstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer opens it up to a page she marked and reads aloud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is from a scientist in France,  Madame Sconce. "The original  werewolves were females. They  became werewolves on the lunar  cycle because it corresponded to  the woman's cycle. My suspicion is  that the only cure is true love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great so all I have to do is fall  in love? Like I haven't tried that  for the past 24 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to read) "The female-cycle werewolf will  only kill men and never kills  someone she truly loves." See I  knew you never loved Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this Madame Sconce? Let's  find her and talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died at age 34 in the 1800's.  They thought she was crazy. She  was banished from her town. Seems  her husband shot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess she never found true love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weird thing is... he shot her  with a silver bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... she was a werewolf. Do you  think we can believe all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What choice do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nearly full moon. A dark cloud passes over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolly through the apartment. We hear the sounds of Frida Peter making love. Move in on the bedroom as they're  finishing. Peter gets behind Frida to cuddle. He cups his hands around her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your breasts feel larger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do? Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a good thing. I like it.  Everything about you is great. I  like how you don't shave your legs.  Women are so much sexier when  they're natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did shave... Do I seem hairy? Peter laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I don't mind hairy. Are  you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida nearly flies out of bed, grabbing whatever she can to cover herself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I should just get up. I have  lots to do today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stares at her strangely as she darts out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is peeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida's furiously cutting her nails which are strangely l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Peter pees, he notices something small and white on th floor. He tries to reach it but can't till he finishes  peeing. Finally he's done. He bends down and picks up the object, which is a large front tooth. Peter has a quick f of Mark's dead face in the car trunk. Missing a tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida notices her long nails and thinks she sees tufts of on her hands. She hears Peter coming and quickly slips on some rubber gloves to hide her hands. ECU of Peter sticking the tooth in his pants pocket. He  enters the kitchen. Something's weighing heavily on his m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to her to kiss her, but Frida, self-conscious abo possible facial hair, bows her head and he ends up kissin top of it. She recoils and he looks at her, concerned. Sh won't let him get a good look at her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have... a lot of... cleaning to  do today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around. Peter shrugs. He knows something's wron He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida nods. Peter leaves. Once he does, Frida rushes to t calendar on the wall and into an ECU of her eye (at edge frame). ECU calendar -- panning past Monday, Tuesday, etc until we see in red ink "the curse." DOLLY IN/ZOOM OUT of Frida's face, reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter takes the tooth out of his pocket and examines it. looks around, sees no one and throws it down a sewer grat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida in one side of the confessional; a PRIEST in the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just wondering... a person  has a choice between killing  themselves or killing others, which  is worse? I mean you fry in hell  either way, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kill yourself, you won't be  around to ask for forgiveness or to  make a last confession, whereas if  you kill others, you can go to  confession, do penance, and be  absolved from your sins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if the person is killing  several people, then maybe it's  better to kill oneself cause then  the killing stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a point. Hmmm... I've  never been asked this before...  Who is being killed? Catholics?  Homosexuals? Protestants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida runs into the room to grab her Midol. She downs som and runs into the bathroom -- searches the medicine cabin for pills. Finds nothing. She looks at herself in the mirror. She has the strange w eyes, nails and teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is looking at a photo of the crime scene in Spencer apartment. He notices Spencer wearing a Los Lobos T-shirt Peter's troubled by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida finds a large knife and practices stabbing herself. tries to slit her wrists but can't. She screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh! I can't even kill myself!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE of Frida trying to kill herself. Frida's on the phone with the yellow pages in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes silver bullets. Do you have  any silver bullets? I only need a  few. No this is not a joke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida hears a dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is walking near the edge of a roof, looking like sh preparing to jump. CU of her feet as she leaps out of fra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida's feet land in frame as though she had jumped here the rooftop shot. She lands in a squat and is picking up  spilled chocolate chips from the floor and eating them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock on Frida's door. Frida has her head in the oven. just see Frida's back half sticking out of the stove. She doesn't answer the door. The knocking continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida? You there? Remember, you  gave me a key for emergencies? I  consider this an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer uses her key and barges in. She looks around and sees Frida sticking out of the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god Frida, don't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her out and Frida has rubber gloves on and is  holding a SOS pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cleaning my stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the shit out of me. I  thought you were killing yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to kill myself -- earlier.  It doesn't work. I think I need  silver bullets. So I got depressed  and when I'm depressed I clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get through this. You were  fine for over three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just afraid I'll hurt Peter. I  think I love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what Madame Sconce said.  If you love him he'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do I know if I really love  Peter? And if he really loves me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can't take that chance. I'd  rather kill myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I won't let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The werewolf always dies at the  end. Didn't you see "American  Werewolf in London?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer and Frida are nailing boards onto the windows to barricade Frida inside. They have put out tons of raw ste and chocolate bars on large plates near the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think George knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Mark? Carlton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Benito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I kill a guy named Benito?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's the guy I'm having an  affair with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're done barricading the window. Jennifer picks up so more wood and nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you and George were  getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were -- I was just so tempted...  It was sort of a test. I think  after sleeping with Benito I know I  want to be with George. But now  George knows about Benito and he  doesn't want to be with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I only had your problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry -- I shouldn't go on about  myself at a time like this. Are  you sure you're going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, just check on me once a day  for the next three days. Then the  PMS should be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer hands Frida the wood and nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just nail shut this door  behind me. I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't deserve a friend like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer leans in and kisses Frida on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer smiles and leaves. After she closes the door, Fr immediately starts nailing boards across the door to shut herself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is resting on the sofa. The door is boarded shut. T phone rings and Frida picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida? You okay? Look, I think I  know what happened to Mark. I want  to help. I'm coming over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! Don't come over. Peter...  I... I don't want to see you  anymore. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Is there someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida hesitates for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks really depressed on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sort of. I mean no, not  really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no? Frida, can't you just  be honest with me?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO FRIDA'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Long pause as they each try to think of something to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You at least owe me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the truth? Remember I  tried to tell you something the  other day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your PMS. Frida I can deal  with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you can't. It... it gets so bad  that I become a werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PETER'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Peter shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't like me, just say so.  You don't have to make up some  bullshit like you're a werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn't believe me!  Just go away. Go very far away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter hears a hang up. He puts the phone down and stares it sadly for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida is crying. She takes the phone off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd walks by Peter's door. Peter calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lloyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd stops and comes in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girlfriend's predicting another  murder in the next few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes her think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says she's on the rag every  time I get called in to investigate  a murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something clicks with Peter. He flips through a calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... they're on some cycle. The  murders... Gregory... then 28 days  later... Carlton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that was 28 days ago today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we get those DNA tests back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this morning. Animal hairs  were found all over the victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of animal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't figure out the species.  Similar to a wolf. They're jokin'  at the lab that a werewolf probably  killed him. Ain't that the  stupidest thing you ever heard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks through the streets, quickly, on a mission. H takes a handful of silver bullets out of his pocket and l at them. He's wearing a red, hooded sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sees Frida's door open and broken wood and nails on floor. He walks into Frida's apartment.  The apartment is quiet, no sign of Frida. The plates that steak and chocolate on them are all empty now. Peter walk around looking for her. He takes his gun out and peers ar the corner, expecting to find something. He hears somethi and spins around facing the front door, pointing the gun. It's Frida. She stands at the front door with a side of b so big she can barely carry it. She gnaws at it. Her eyes are glowing orange. She sees Peter and looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away. I might hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid. Frida! I love  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter I love you too but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you'll hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida, still gnawing at the beef, circles him slowly. He' scared but he lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you would. No matter  what form you take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take that chance... I  couldn't live with myself if I did  anything to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the silver bullets in case I  need to protect myself. Does that  make you feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sets the gun on the table. He takes a few steps clo Frida backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you bite me and then I'll be  like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It doesn't work that way. Men  can't get PMS. Unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying here with you tonight.  There's no getting rid of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps closer again and now Frida's backed up against t wall. He can see her eyes look strangely wolf-like. He's  afraid but inches closer. Frida tries to inch away. It's  almost like a dance. Finally they find their way to each  other and embrace -- the side of beef between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise to shoot me if I attack  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter closes his eyes and nods. Frida sniffs the side of hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you order up some chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is sitting up in bed reading Madame Sconce's werewo book. Frida is beside him asleep. Peter looks at her and  strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same dolly in we've seen a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida's asleep in bed. Dolly the same as when she woke up with the severed arm. Frida wakes up. She's afraid to loo behind her for fear she's killed Peter. All she sees is a empty pillow. She looks under the sheets. Nothing -- just pure white, no blood. Frida smiles and sighs in relief. From the next room, Frida hears whistling. Peter walks in carrying a "breakfast in bed" tray. On the tray is a huge rare steak and a red rose. Frida sits up. Peter brings the tray to her and places it on her lap. He sits at the foot of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn't kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have children. I  don't think I'd kill the father of  my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can work this out. Other  couples have worse problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse than this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Cheating, lying. What's a  little werewolf a few days a month?  We can move out to the country  where you can feed off deer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about... those guys... I might  have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way can anything be proved. All  they have are some wolf hairs. No  one believes in werewolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry... I... I couldn't  help it. You know I didn't mean  to... to do any of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. The important thing is  that it stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida nods as she digs into her steak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is eating a chocolate bar. She looks sad and her is pale and makeup-less. She's headed for her door and op it to reveal George. He smiles sheepishly at her. She bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George pulls out a can of Readi-Whip from his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sneezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida's still eating. Peter gets up and kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk out. Frida continues with her steak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stops at the door and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. For everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter smiles and continues out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's dialing on her cordless phone. George is in th background covering his crotch with the whipped cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida's still in bed chowing down. We hear the shower run in the background. The phone rings; Frida picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida? You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been better. Peter spent the  night. I must really love him.  He's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank god. Maybe this whole  thing is really over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God I hope so. Hey can I call you  later? Peter's still here. He's  in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer hangs up. Then suddenly something occurs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of the gun with silver bullets still on the table wher Peter left it the night before. We hear Peter in the show humming the tune from "Peter and the Wolf." The camera  dollies from the gun into the bathroom. It continues to d in as before when Mark was in the shower. Danger seems  imminent... Peter hears Frida calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter? Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolly in close on his face. Behind him, through the showe curtain, we see the blurry figure of Frida. Peter's a bit worried for a moment too. He pulls back the curtain so he see her. She's standing there holding a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tension is broken. Peter's completely relieved. Frida hangs the towel on the towel rack and leaves. Peter goes to soaping himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Frida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida comes back into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida beams. She tosses off her robe and gets in the show Frida and Peter kiss and suds each other up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to do your back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida turns around. Peter starts scrubbing her back. Frid appears to be enjoying it -- though we can't see her face because she has her head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't this feel great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frida nodes her head. She lifts it and we see her face. H eyes are glowing. She smiles and we see fangs. Freeze fra on CU of her eyes.
